Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

The theorem asserts that the set of proper divisors of a prime number is empty or, equivalently, that a prime number's only proper divisor is 1.

type: ∀ {p : ℕ}, p.Prime → p.properDivisors = {1}
name: Nat.Prime.properDivisors
docString: The theorem asserts that the set of proper divisors of a prime number is empty or, equivalently, that a prime number's only proper divisor is 1.

This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, `n` divides 1 if and only if `n` is equal to 1. In terms of number theory, this means that 1 can only be divided evenly (i.e., without remainder) by the number 1 itself.

name: Nat.dvd_one
docString: This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, `n` divides 1 if and only if `n` is equal to 1. In terms of number theory, this means that 1 can only be divided evenly (i.e., without remainder) by the number 1 itself.

The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [dec_irr : (p : Associates α) → Decidable (Irreducible p)]
  [inst_1 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid α] [dec : DecidableEq α] [dec' : DecidableEq (Associates α)] {a p : Associates α},
  Irreducible p →
    ∀ [inst_2 : (n : ℕ) → Decidable (a ∣ p ^ n)] {n : ℕ} (h : a ∣ p ^ n),
      a = p ^ Nat.find (_ : ∃ n, (fun n => a ∣ p ^ n) n)
name: Associates.eq_pow_find_of_dvd_irreducible_pow
docString: The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers.

For any natural number n, n divides 1 if and only if n = 1.

name: Nat.dvd_one
docString: For any natural number n, n divides 1 if and only if n = 1.

This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, if `n` divides 1, then `n` must be equal to 1. In mathematical terms, it asserts that if `n` is a divisor of 1 in the set of natural numbers, its value has to be 1. This is because 1 is the only natural number that can divide 1 to yield another natural number.

name: Nat.eq_one_of_dvd_one
docString: This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, if `n` divides 1, then `n` must be equal to 1. In mathematical terms, it asserts that if `n` is a divisor of 1 in the set of natural numbers, its value has to be 1. This is because 1 is the only natural number that can divide 1 to yield another natural number.

No zero divisors.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [self : CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring α] {a b : α}, a * b = 0 → a = 0 ∨ b = 0
name: CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring.eq_zero_or_eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero
docString: No zero divisors.

The GCD is a divisor of the second element.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] (a b : α), gcd a b ∣ b
name: GCDMonoid.gcd_dvd_right
docString: The GCD is a divisor of the second element.

The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] (a b : α), gcd a b ∣ a
name: GCDMonoid.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] {a b c : α}, a ∣ c → a ∣ b → a ∣ gcd c b
name: GCDMonoid.dvd_gcd
docString: Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

Two pnats are coprime if their gcd is 1.

type: ℕ+ → ℕ+ → Prop
name: PNat.Coprime
docString: Two pnats are coprime if their gcd is 1.

The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), Nat.divisors (m * n) = Nat.divisors m * Nat.divisors n
name: Nat.divisors_mul
docString:
The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1`

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), Nat.factorization n = 0 ↔ n = 0 ∨ n = 1
name: Nat.factorization_eq_zero_iff'
docString: The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1`

If a small natural number is divisible by a larger natural number,
the small number is zero.

type: ∀ {a b : ℕ}, a ∣ b → b < a → b = 0
name: Nat.eq_zero_of_dvd_of_lt
docString:
If a small natural number is divisible by a larger natural number,
the small number is zero.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples.

name: Nat.dvd_right_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples.

The prime divisors of the characteristic of a finite commutative ring are exactly
the prime divisors of its cardinality.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : Fintype R] (p : ℕ) [inst_2 : Fact (Nat.Prime p)],
  p ∣ ringChar R ↔ p ∣ Fintype.card R
name: prime_dvd_char_iff_dvd_card
docString:
The prime divisors of the characteristic of a finite commutative ring are exactly
the prime divisors of its cardinality.

An algebraic integer whose conjugates are all of norm one is a root of unity.

type:
∀ (K : Type u_1) [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : NumberField K] (A : Type u_2) [inst_2 : NormedField A]
  [inst_3 : IsAlgClosed A] [inst_4 : NormedAlgebra ℚ A] {x : K},
  IsIntegral ℤ x → (∀ (φ : K →+* A), ‖φ x‖ = 1) → ∃ n, ∃ (_ : 0 < n), x ^ n = 1
name: NumberField.Embeddings.pow_eq_one_of_norm_eq_one
docString: An algebraic integer whose conjugates are all of norm one is a root of unity.

Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x ≠ 0
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_ne_zero'
docString: Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  0 < IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_zero_le
docString: Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

name: PNat.gcd
docString:
The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

type: Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}
name: Nat.factorization_inj
docString: Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

The greatest common divisor between two elements.

type: {α : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [self : GCDMonoid α] → α → α → α
name: GCDMonoid.gcd
docString: The greatest common divisor between two elements.

An element a divides the sum a + b if and only if a divides b.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Ring α] {a b : α}, a ∣ a + b ↔ a ∣ b
name: dvd_add_self_left
docString: An element a divides the sum a + b if and only if a divides b.
